page.title: 09Sampford Brett Players
page.content: The{Sampford Brett Players}are a group of amateur actors and actresses. They usually put on a{play {twice a year.}The plays are three act plays. They borrow a written script from Glastonbury then act it out. If they put on a play in{April}they usually start to rehearse in{January. {They have up to 20}rehearsals two nights a week. They have to{build}their own {stage and scenery .}They have no curtains, because there is nowhere to hang them.So each time they change scenery it is done in almost complete darkness.The village hall can hold up to eighty people.Each play is put on for three nights a Thursday, Friday and Saturday. Each time there is a costume play they{make all the clothes themselves.There are dressing rooms at the back of the hall.
